reviewText: As a father of a young child, I purchased this based on the other reviews. While it wasn't bad, it was rather dificult to stomach. It tries way too hard to be funny and misses out on teaching the kids any kind of lesson.The songs are in fact "silly," but they aren't as catchy as some of the competition (i.e. the Wiggles). I cannot immagine being stuck in a car and having to listen to the DVD again and again for a long road trip.The video is mindless silly-ness on the same level as Looney Tunes, nothing more.
summary: There are better choices for children

Title: N/A

reviewText: . . .provided by "The Pirates Who Don't Do Anything"!This video is a "must-have" for all fans of Bob the Tomato, Larry the Cucumber and all the rest of your salad-drawer favorites!  What the producers of "Veggie-Tales" have done in this video is to take the funniest of the "Silly Songs" from the last umpteen videos and present them in a "Top 10 Countdown" format, familiar to anyone who has ever listened to the radio or watched music television.In between the various songs, the viewer is treated to hysterical commentary by "The Pirates Who Don't Do Anything" as the tabulation machine routinely malfunctions.  Not to be missed is Larry the Cucumber and Mr. Lunt as they rap to a Chinese restaurant menu.  Finally, demonstrating once again that cartoons are presented on many levels, the countdown concludes with a "voting controversy" when Pa Grape "discovers" a hitherto unknown bag of "uncounted votes".  Certainly a humorous spoof on the 2000 elections!This collection of songs from the "Veggie-Tales" series is highly recommended!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is without a doubt a very awesome veggietales! Lots of awesome songs with awesome silliness. It is full of songs from some of the greatest veggietales stories ever. The pirates who don,t do anything are the hosts and  there are some funny surprises too. This is one veggietale you will really enjoy for many generations.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The first time I watched this, I laughed so hard-- even better, my then five-month-old son giggled his little heart out when "Endangered Love" started!  That song happens to be my favorite from this collection and I feel that it should have been #1 instead of #10, but I won't get into that.  All in all, the whole DVD is entertaining although I do tend to skip past the initial bit about the Pirates Who Don't Do Anything.  This DVD has proven to be a surefire way to cheer up my baby (now one and a half!) and I recommend it to anyone with small children or anyone who can appreciate a good Silly Song!  My family's favorite songs:  Endangered Love, His Cheeseburger, and Love My Lips.
summary: Entertainment for the young and old!
Title: N/A

reviewText: After accepting a babysitting job for a friend, I was introduced to this DVD by their one year old son. Like most little children, once is never enough. We had the DVD on most of the day and I knew all the songs by heart. But best of all, I wasn't completely sick of the show! The songs are silly, but catchy. And I got a kick out of watching the little boy dance to 'Barbara Manatee'. :) With the Christmas season coming up, this would be a delightful present to find under the tree.

reviewText: I absolutely adore VeggieTales films, they are so much fun and are totally hilarious. :) Before I deliberate upon this edition to the VeggieTales film collection, I just have one thing to say. If you haven't seen VeggieTales before, no matter what age you are, go to your local film store, get online,etc... wherever it is that you buy films, and purchase at least one, I don't believe anyone could be sorry after buying a VeggieTales animated film. :)Ok, here goes on my review... ;) Veggie Tales- The Ultimate Silly Song Countdown is the, um, Ultimate Countdown to discover just which of Larry's Silly Songs are the whipped cream of the banana split, the cream of the crop, the cheese of a cheeseburger, well, you get the point. Included in The Ultimate Countdown are wonderful songs such as, "Barbara Manatee," "the Pirates who don't do anything," "The Yodeling Veterinarian of the Alps." As well as others, but which one will be the #1 Silly Song. My lips are sealed, to find out all you have to do is borrow, rent, or purchase it, how much better could it be?
summary: "If you like to talk to tomatoes..." :)
Title: N/A

reviewText: Silly Songs with Larry is a fan favorite segment from the Veggie Tales series.  Here's a collection of all 10 Silly Song videos, in order of popularity.  And there are some great songs here.  Everything from the original, "The Water Buffalo Song," to "The Yodeling Veterinarian of the Alps" (my favorite) and the most recent, "Larry's High Silk Hat."  Hosted by the "Pirates Who Don't Do Anything," it's a fun collection to sit back and enjoy.This is a best of video.  As such, there is little new material.  But for those who want all the silly songs in one place, this is a great way to do it.  The DVD contains some fun features, such as interviews with creators Mike and Phil and the Moo Shoo Karaoke.  Also hidden as an Easter Egg are:  the only "missing" silly song, "O Santa," "Lost Puppies" from the Esther video, and "The Hairbrush Song" in Japanese.Long time fans might be disappointed with the lack of new material here, but I'm glad to have this DVD in my collection.  It's the perfect thing to watch when you need a grin.

reviewText: This is a staple for us. My son watches it everytime we get in the car. Now when Bob and Larry come on at home, his eyes literally light up. I've even used the songs in church for a Children's Sermon. You will love each song because they're just plain silly. The title says it all. You can't go wrong with this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ever wondered which silly song from the Veggie Tales videos is the silliest? Well, you are just about to find out! Hosted by the Pirates Who Don't Do Anything (aka Larry the cucumber, Pa Grape, and Mr. Lunt), "The Ultimate Silly Song Countdown" is, well... just what is says. The countdown to which song is the silliest of all! After collecting votes from Veggie Tales fans, you'll be able to know the results. Is it "The Cheeseburger Song"? "I Love My Lips"? "The Hairbrush Song"? Find out as you watch this hilariously fun 43 minutes program!For a while I've been thinking that the Veggie Tales are only for younger kids and especially not for teenagers. But after getting a few tapes from my friends and watching them, I realized I was totally wrong! I just really LOVE the videos and I've been enjoying watching them with my parents! And probably my most favorite Veggie Tale is "The Ultimate Silly Song Countdown". The songs are just so silly that my parents and I were just laughing, laughing, and laughing! In our opinions though, are favorites are "Endangered Love" and "I Love My Lips". The "Water Buffalo Song" is pretty fun, too. And it's not just the songs which are great, whenever the countdown machine malfunctions, you get to watch the Pirates Who Don't Do Anything, who are also extremely silly. So if you like Veggie Tales, heard of it, or even if you've never even heard of it, I highly recommend you watch this tape! (And also, don't miss the dance mixes of the silly songs at the very end.)The other Veggie Tale videos are also very enjoyable with great Christian values, each teaching a very valuable lesson. One of my favorites is "King George and the Ducky", which teaches about selfishness.
summary: WARNING: This tape contains high doeses of extreme sillines!

reviewText: Veggie Tales stories are fun, but the songs are the my favorite part.  So when I saw a compilation of them I had to buy it.  I avoided Veggie Tales for a long time because I thought that since they were religious lessons they'd be boring.  But they truly are not.  They are fabulous tales for all kinds of Christians - devout, moderate, liberal...whatever.  They entertain and teach values without cramming anything down anyone's throat....  The songs and stories are clever and humurous.  The characters are endearing...They have me laughing out loud much of the time.
summary: My kids and I love Veggie Tale songs!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video is a must-have for Silly Song Fans everywhere.Hosted by "The Pirates Who Don't Do Anything", this is a countdown show from the #10 Silly Song to the #1 favorite Silly Song of all time.  The votes (taken on the Veggie Tales website) have been tabulated by the "Astonishing Contraption of Silliness."  Occasionally, there is a glitch in the machine, which causes a very mixed-up title, but the Silly Songs on this video will no doubt be YOUR favorites from the Veggie Tales series.You will get to see 10 full-length Silly Songs.  This video is 43 minutes long, about 13 minutes longer than most Veggie Tales videos.  If you have children who will want to watch the same songs over and over, obviously the DVD would be a better choice for you!The only reason I gave this 4 stars and not 5 is that there isn't any really new material.  They do have an entertaining format in how they announce the next song, but the songs are all ones that Veggie Tales fans have heard before.Be watching for Veggie Tales' full-length movie, "Jonah" to appear in theaters in 2002!Please check out my reviews of Christian videos, books, and music!
summary: And what is YOUR favorite Veggie Tales' Silly Song??
Title: N/A

reviewText: My four-month-old son loves these silly songs!  I wanted to use it as a way to introduce him to Veggie Tales ("Why is there a dancing pickle?").  And he immediately loved it.  Usually, when I play anything other than his favorite Baby Einstein collection, he just screams and only Baby Mozart will do.  But he loves the Ultimate Silly Song Countdown -- the colors, movement, music (especially the silly tones and inflections used).  Another plus is that *it isn't annoying for parents to hear*!  I know just a few words of the songs, and when I sing them to my son, he gives me a great big smile and laugh.  I need to learn more so my husband and I can sign these silly songs all around the house!
Title: N/A

reviewText: No Veggie fan should be without this newest release from Big Idea Productions. Many surprises and much fun!
